body_html:
Hi,

I have this same problem trying to install Tensor Flow from source on a CentOS 6.7 machine. I've tried with both bazel 0.1.1 and 0.1.3. With 0.1.1, I get:

$ pwd
$HOME/code/tensorflow
$ bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --verbose_failures --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing
WARNING: Output base '$HOME/.cache/bazel/_bazel_mpost/891d341da8754b366638c3a40c9b09f5' is on NFS. This may lead to surprising failures and undetermined behavior.
ERROR: Loading of target '//tools/jdk:GenClass_deploy.jar' failed; build aborted: no such target '//tools/jdk:GenClass_deploy.jar': target 'GenClass_deploy.jar' not declared in package 'tools/jdk' defined by $HOME/.bazel/base_workspace/tools/jdk/BUILD.
ERROR: Loading failed; build aborted.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.034s

The documentation doesn't seem to address this. Do you have any suggestions?

body:
Hi,

I have this same problem trying to install Tensor Flow from source on a CentOS 6.7 machine. I've tried with both bazel 0.1.1 and 0.1.3. With 0.1.1, I get:

```
$ pwd
$HOME/code/tensorflow
$ bazel build -c opt //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package --verbose_failures --ignore_unsupported_sandboxing
WARNING: Output base '$HOME/.cache/bazel/_bazel_mpost/891d341da8754b366638c3a40c9b09f5' is on NFS. This may lead to surprising failures and undetermined behavior.
ERROR: Loading of target '//tools/jdk:GenClass_deploy.jar' failed; build aborted: no such target '//tools/jdk:GenClass_deploy.jar': target 'GenClass_deploy.jar' not declared in package 'tools/jdk' defined by $HOME/.bazel/base_workspace/tools/jdk/BUILD.
ERROR: Loading failed; build aborted.
INFO: Elapsed time: 0.034s
```

The documentation doesn't seem to address this. Do you have any suggestions?
